title: Astronauts Come Home Early from Space for Health Check
summary: Four astronauts came back to Earth early from the International Space Station because one of them had a health problem. They landed safely in the Pacific Ocean near San Diego using a SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft. The astronauts had been in space for 167 days, but they left over a month early to get medical help on the ground. NASA said it was not an emergency because the sick astronaut was stable, but they wanted to make sure they got proper treatment. The other astronauts on the station will now have fewer people to help with work until new astronauts arrive next month. This is the first time NASA has ended a space mission early for medical reasons.

questions.question: How long had the astronauts been in space before returning?

background_read: Space missions involve astronauts living on the International Space Station to do science experiments and learn about space. Sometimes, health issues can happen, and NASA has plans to bring astronauts home safely. This article talks about the first time NASA ended a mission early for medical reasons, showing how space agencies care for astronaut health.
Article_Structure: WHO: Four astronauts from NASA, Japan, and Russia
WHAT: They returned early from the International Space Station due to a medical issue
WHERE: They landed in the Pacific Ocean near San Diego
WHY: To provide medical treatment for a sick astronaut on the ground

perspectives.description: NASA prioritized astronaut health by bringing them home early, even though it was not an emergency.
